title: Rejoice Employees! Under New Employment Bill, Restaurants Now Have To Give Tips To All Workers
text:
Rejoice Employees! Under New Employment Bill, Restaurants Now Have To Give Tips To All Workers

Rejoice Employees! Under New Employment Bill, Restaurants Now Have To Give Tips To All Workers

As part of a new bill announced today by the Queen, all the workers in restaurants, pubs and hotels will receive 100% of their tips. "My government will take steps to make work fairer, introducing measures that will support those working hard," she said.

Currently, companies are following a system that has no legal obligation to pass service charge to the staff. The new bill will now let the employees take advantage of the tips given to them and this will apply to companies in England, Scotland and Wales.

TIME

The new Employment Bill will ensure that the cash (tip) is given to the staff; that means restaurateurs will have to 'pass on all tips, gratuities and service charges to workers without deductions'.

A lot of the time, servers and waiters miss out on tips simply because there are no rules with regard to this. Tips are not meant for restaurants, they are meant for individual workers.

Finally, now the system will be transparent.

We all wish we get full appreciation, wherever we work! Just like this decision, when a UK company, Portcullis Legals switched over to a four-day working week, and said that its staff and customers have never been happier.
description: As part of a new bill announced today by the Queen, all the workers in restaurants, pubs and hotels will receive 100% of their tips. Finally, the system will now be transparent and help workers get their due. Restaurants can no longer pocket the money that does not belong to them.
